Title: Nearshore Marine Ecosystem Research Program

Other_Citation_Details:
This is a link to the broader USGS Alaska Science Center research project supported by these data. Users will find a description of the research project and links to associated reports, publications, and data products.
Online_Linkage: https://alaska.usgs.gov/portal/project.php?project_id=99
Description:
Abstract:
These data are part of the Gulf Watch Alaska (GWA) long-term monitoring program. This dataset consists of date, time, and temperature measurements from intertidal rocky sampling sites, including predicted tide height at the time of the reading, which is used to distinguish air from water temperature readings. The data are provided as comma separated values (.csv) files derived from data downloaded from HOBO temperature loggers.
Purpose:
The purpose of this dataset is to document intertidal water and air temperatures at rocky intertidal study sites. Sampling was conducted in rocky intertidal habitats within each of the GWA regions: Kenai Peninsula (KEFJ), Katmai (KATM), Kachemak Bay (KBAY) and Prince William Sound (NPWS. EPWS, and WPWS). The purpose of rocky intertidal sampling is to assess change in intertidal invertebrate and algal communities in sheltered rocky habitats.
Supplemental_Information:
This versioned data release supersedes two previous nearshore temperature USGS data releases (https://doi.org/10.5066/F7WH2N3T and https://doi.org/10.5066/F77S7KXH). The data provided in this release includes all data from past releases as well as new data collected after 2017 for KBAY, KEFJ, WPWS, and KATM. This data release will continue to be updated as new data are collected each sampling year.

Data_Quality_Information:
Attribute_Accuracy:
Attribute_Accuracy_Report:
These are the raw, uncorrected data downloaded directly from the HOBO temperature loggers. Non-deployment times have been clipped from the front and back end of each download. Files were examined for outliers.
Calibration procedures began in 2016. HOBOs recovered in 2016 went through a series of calibration soaks in a laboratory controlled water bath at 0, 10 and 20 °C for one hour at each temperature, and logged temperatures were compared with these known water bath temperatures.
HOBOs deployed after 2016 went through the same calibration process prior to deployment to assure that all HOBOs were recording temperature values within the manufactures guaranteed accuracy (±0.21°C, see below). Any HOBOs that were not logging temperatures within this level of accuracy were returned to the manufacturer.
Published HOBO specifications: Temperature Sensor Accuracy ±0.21°C from 0° to 50°C (±0.38°F from 32° to 122°F), Resolution 0.02°C at 25°C (0.04°F at 77°F), Response Time (90%) 5 minutes in water; 12 minutes in air moving 2 m/sec (typical) Stability (Drift) 0.1°C (0.18°F) per year.
Logical_Consistency_Report:
These are the raw, uncorrected data downloaded directly from the HOBO temperature loggers. False or unexpected temperature values may be present. Data users are advised to examine the data prior to use.
Completeness_Report:
In some years instruments were lost, not deployed, or loggers failed; therefore, there are gaps in data when any of these occurred. There is no .csv file for KATM_2011-2012 because no HOBO loggers were deployed in that year for that block.
Positional_Accuracy:
Horizontal_Positional_Accuracy:
Horizontal_Positional_Accuracy_Report:
Locations for the endpoints of the transect are accurate to within several meters. Most have an accuracy under 15 meters. See the site location data release for rocky site locations: https://dx.doi.org/10.5066/F78S4N3R (Coletti et al. 2017)
Lineage:
Methodology:
Methodology_Type: Field
Methodology_Description:
Temperatures were measured using Hobo Water Temperature Pr v2 Data Loggers - U22-001. These were manufactured by Onset Computer Corp., 470 MacArthur Blvd., Bourne, MA, 02532. Instruments have a reported range of -40 to 70 degrees C in air and -40 to 50 degrees C in water. Instruments are accurate to + or - .21 degrees C over a range of temperatures from 0 to 50 degrees C.
Methodology:
Methodology_Type: Field
Methodology_Description:
Temperature loggers were deployed during rocky site sampling in one year and removed for data download approximately one year later using Onset's waterproof shuttle and HOBOware Pro software. Temperature was measured at 0.5 m and 1.5 m Mean Low Low Water (MLLW) elevation at each site and at a few sites at 2.5 m MLLW. The tidal elevations are nominal values and may potentially differ by an estimated maximum of 20 cm from the actual elevation, but were at the same elevation as the nominal sampling locations for intertidal invertebrates and algae. Temperature loggers measured air temperature when tidal levels were below them and water temperature when tidal levels were above them. At one site in each monitoring region, Amalik in the Alaska Peninsula Region, McCarty in the Kenai Peninsula Region, and Whale in western Prince William Sound, an array of temperature loggers was deployed for a year.
Methodology:
Methodology_Type: Lab
Methodology_Description:
Calibration procedures began in 2016. Temperature loggers recovered in 2016 went through a series of calibration soaks in a laboratory-controlled water bath at 0, 10 and 20 °C for one hour at each temperature, and logged temperatures were compared with these known water bath temperatures. Temperature loggers deployed since 2016 undergo the same calibration process before deployment and after retrieval. Those not recording temperature values within the manufactures guaranteed accuracy (±0.21°C) prior to deployment were not used.
The temperature loggers deployed at Kaflia from July 2014 to July 2015 returned temperatures approximately 2.6 °C lower than the temperature loggers deployed at the same site immediately before and after it. The calibration procedures also found an average difference of -2.6 °C. Similarly, the temperature logger deployed at Kaflia from July 2015 to July 2016 was found to have and average difference of -0.85 °C during the post-deployment calibration procedure. This same temperature logger was deployed at Iktua from June 2014 to June 2015. We have corrected those temperature readings by adding 2.6 degrees C and 0.85 degrees C as appropriate. For the affected files, only the corrected temperature values are provided.

Title:
Gulf Watch Alaska Nearshore Component: Monitoring Site Locations from Prince William Sound, Katmai National Park and Preserve, and Kenai Fjords National Park
Geospatial_Data_Presentation_Form: tabular digital data
Series_Information:
Series_Name: U.S. Geological Survey Data Release
Issue_Identification: 10.5066/F78S4N3R
Publication_Information:

Publisher: U.S. Geological Survey, Alaska Science Center

Coletti, H.A., Kloecker, K.A., Bodkin, J.L., Dean, T.A., 2017. Gulf Watch Alaska Nearshore Component: Monitoring Site Locations from Prince William Sound, Katmai National Park and Preserve, and Kenai Fjords National Park: U.S. Geological Survey data release, https://doi.org/10.5066/F78S4N3R
Online_Linkage: https://doi.org/10.5066/F78S4N3R
Type_of_Source_Media: document
Source_Time_Period_of_Content:
Time_Period_Information:
Single_Date/Time:
Calendar_Date: 2017
Source_Currentness_Reference: publication date
Source_Citation_Abbreviation: Coletti et al. 2017
Source_Contribution: Geographic coordinates of sampling sites
Process_Step:
Process_Description:
Data were downloaded from the HOBO temperature loggers using Onset's waterproof shuttle and HOBOware Pro software.
Process_Date: Unknown
Process_Step:
Process_Description:
Data were edited to remove temperatures recorded before or after deployment in the field as well as anomalous readings outside of expected temperature bounds.
Process_Date: Unknown
Process_Step:
Process_Description:
New columns were appended to the columns directly output from the temperature loggers. The newly added columns were: 'block', 'site', 'tide_height', 'position', and 'HOBO_ID'. See entity/attribute section for definitions of these columns.
Source_Used_Citation_Abbreviation: Dean and Bodkin 2011
Process_Date: Unknown
Process_Step:
Process_Description:
HOBO temperature reading (degrees Celsius) standardized to 30-minute intervals (on the hour and half hour). Most HOBOs were programed to record temperature every 30-minutes. However, in early years temperature logging intervals were 20, 30 or 60-minutes. When temperature was logged at intervals other than every 30 minutes, interpolation was used to estimate the value at 30-minute intervals.
Source_Used_Citation_Abbreviation: Dean and Bodkin 2011
Process_Date: Unknown
Process_Step:
Process_Description:
We added predicted tide height. The predicted tide heights were determined using the Tide and Currents software (Nobeltec, https://mdnautical.com/) and the tide station nearest each site. List of site/tide station pairings: KATM Amalik Bay site = Takli Island tide station; KATM Kinak Bay site = Takli Island tide station; KATM Takli Island site = Takli Island tide station; KATM Kaflia Bay site = Kukak Bay tide station; KATM Kukak Bay site = Kukak Bay tide station; KEFJ Aialik Bay site = Aialik Sill tide station; KEFJ Harris Bay site = Upper NW Fjords tide station; KEFJ McCarty Lagoon site = Chance Cove tide station; KEFJ Nuka Bay site = Nuka Bay tide station; KEFJ Nuka Pass site = Nuka Pass tide station; WPWS Herring Bay site = Herring Point tide station; WPWS Hogan Bay site = Hogan Bay tide station; WPWS Iktua Bay site = Guguak tide station; WPWS Johnson Bay site = Port Audrey tide station; WPWS Whale Bay site = Chenega tide station; NPWS Cedar Bay site = Glacier Island tide station; NPWS Esther Passage site = Culross Bay tide station; NPWS Bettles Bay site = Culross Bay tide station; NPWS Perry Island site = Applegate tide station; EPWS Galena Bay site = Rocky Point tide station; EPWS Port Fidalgo site = Landlocked tide station; EPWS Olsen Bay site = Port Gravina tide station; EPWS Simpson Bay site = Hawkins Island tide station; EPWS Observation Island site = Orca Inlet tide station; KBAY Bishop Beach site = Anchor Point tide station; KBAY Bluff Point site = Anchor Point tide station; KBAY Cohen Island site = Homer tide station; KBAY Elephant Island site = Homer tide station; KBAY Outside Beach site = Seldovia tide station; KBAY Port Graham site = Port Graham tide station
Process_Date: Unknown
Process_Step:
Process_Description:
Air vs. water temperature readings were determined from the predicted tidal elevation at the time of the temperature reading and the tide height at which the logger was deployed. A temperature reading was considered water temperature when the predicted tidal elevation was at least 0.5 m higher than the tide height at which the logger was deployed. A temperature reading was considered air temperature when the predicted tidal elevation was at least 0.5 m lower than the tide height at which the logger was deployed. A temperature reading was considered a transition temperature when the predicted tidal elevation was within 0.5 m of the tide height at which the logger was deployed.
Process_Date: Unknown
Spatial_Data_Organization_Information:
Indirect_Spatial_Reference:
The only spatial information in these data are the named locations for the sampling sites. Sites are documented with start and end coordinates and are also referred to by site name (e.g., Herring Bay rocky sampling site). Please refer to Coletti et al. 2017, a USGS data release which provides for geographic coordinates of all sites: https://doi.org/10.5066/F78S4N3R
Direct_Spatial_Reference_Method: Point

Entity_and_Attribute_Information:
Detailed_Description:
Entity_Type:
Entity_Type_Label: Intertidal_Temperature_[BLOCK]_[YYY1]-[YYY2].csv
Entity_Type_Definition:
Six folders with tables of water and air temperature data. Each folder contains data from one sampling "Block" (KBAY, KEFJ, NPWS, WPWS, EPWS, KATM), as defined in Coletti et al. 2017. Within folders, there is a table for each sample year (i.e., from June 1st of one year to May 31st the following year). Presented in a Comma Separated Value (CSV) formatted tables.
Filenaming convention: [BLOCK] is the name of the sampling "block", [YYY1] is the deployment year, [YYY2] is the download year.
Entity_Type_Definition_Source: Author defined
Attribute:
Attribute_Label: block
Attribute_Definition:
Name of sampling block within each sampling region, as defined in Coletti et al 2017, https://doi.org/10.5066/F78S4N3R
Attribute_Definition_Source: Coletti et al. 2017
Attribute_Domain_Values:
Enumerated_Domain:

Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition: Kachemak Bay (Block 04, Region = Kenai Peninsula)
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition_Source: Author defined

Attribute:
Attribute_Label: site
Attribute_Definition:
Name of sampling site within each sampling block, as defined in Coletti et al 2017, https://doi.org/10.5066/F78S4N3R.
Attribute_Definition_Source: Coletti et al. 2017
Attribute_Domain_Values:
Unrepresentable_Domain: Name of sampling sites within each sampling block
Attribute:
Attribute_Label: date
Attribute_Definition: Date (YYYY-MM-DD) of temperature reading.
Attribute_Definition_Source: Author defined
Attribute_Domain_Values:
Unrepresentable_Domain:
Date of temperature reading corresponding to the range of years presented by each table.
Attribute:
Attribute_Label: time
Attribute_Definition: Time (24-hr) of temperature reading, local time (UTC -8 h).
Attribute_Definition_Source: Author defined
Attribute_Domain_Values:
Unrepresentable_Domain: Time of temperature reading (HH:mm).
Attribute:
Attribute_Label: sensor
Attribute_Definition:
Name for the temperature logger position. A concatenation of 'site_name' (Coletti et al. 2017), 'tide_height', and 'position'. Example: "Fidalgo_0.5a"
Attribute_Definition_Source: Author defined
Attribute_Domain_Values:
Unrepresentable_Domain: Name for the temperature logger position.
Attribute:
Attribute_Label: HOBO_ID
Attribute_Definition:
Unique ID of each HOBO temperature logger, assigned by the manufacturer. Instruments were re-deployed after download, and therefore not unique to a single site or year. HOBO IDs listed as "-9999999" indicates that the ID number is unknown.
Attribute_Definition_Source: Onset (https://www.onsetcomp.com/)
Attribute_Domain_Values:
Unrepresentable_Domain:
Unique ID of each HOBO temperature logger, assigned by the manufacturer.
Attribute:
Attribute_Label: tide_height
Attribute_Definition:
Tidal elevation of temperature logger. The vertical height (in meters) above mean lower low water (MLLW). Temperature loggers were set at 0.5 m, 1.5 m, and 2.5 m above MLLW. The "standard" tidal elevation (with longest time-series) is 0.5 m. Since 2014, temperature loggers have also been deployed at 1.5 m. Additionally, for one sample year (2014-2015), temperature loggers were deployed at 2.5 m.
Attribute_Definition_Source: Author defined
Attribute_Domain_Values:
Enumerated_Domain:
Enumerated_Domain_Value: 0.5
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition: 0.5 meters above MLLW
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition_Source: Author defined
Attribute_Domain_Values:
Enumerated_Domain:
Enumerated_Domain_Value: 1.5
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition: 1.5 meters above MLLW
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition_Source: Author defined
Attribute_Domain_Values:
Enumerated_Domain:
Enumerated_Domain_Value: 2.5
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition: 2.5 meters above MLLW
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition_Source: Author defined
Attribute:
Attribute_Label: position
Attribute_Definition:
The position of the temperature logger along the intertidal sampling transect (start, middle, end). Middle and end positions were only used at the 0.5 meter tidal elevation for one year (2014-2015).
Attribute_Definition_Source: Author defined
Attribute_Domain_Values:
Enumerated_Domain:
Enumerated_Domain_Value: a
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition: Standard position at start of the transect line
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition_Source: Author defined
Attribute_Domain_Values:
Enumerated_Domain:
Enumerated_Domain_Value: b
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition: Midpoint along the transect line
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition_Source: Author defined
Attribute_Domain_Values:
Enumerated_Domain:
Enumerated_Domain_Value: c
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition: End of the transect line
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition_Source: Author defined
Attribute:
Attribute_Label: tidelevl
Attribute_Definition:
Predicted tide level (meters) at the time of the temperature reading. Tide prediction taken from Tides and Currents program using the nearest tide station to the site. See processing steps for a list of tide station locations.
Attribute_Definition_Source: Author defined
Attribute_Domain_Values:
Unrepresentable_Domain:
Predicted tide level (meters) at the time of the temperature reading.
Attribute:
Attribute_Label: exposure
Attribute_Definition:
An indicator for the type of temperature reading listed in the "temperature" attribute.
Attribute_Definition_Source: Author defined
Attribute_Domain_Values:
Enumerated_Domain:
Enumerated_Domain_Value: air
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition:
Air when the predicted tidal elevation was at least 0.5 m lower than the tide height at which the logger was deployed. Temperature logger readings (degrees Celsius) at 30-minute intervals.
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition_Source: Author defined
Attribute_Domain_Values:
Enumerated_Domain:
Enumerated_Domain_Value: transition
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition:
Transition when the predicted tidal elevation was within 0.5 m of the tide height at which the logger was deployed. Temperature logger readings (degrees Celsius) at 30-minute intervals.
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition_Source: Author defined
Attribute_Domain_Values:
Enumerated_Domain:
Enumerated_Domain_Value: water
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition:
Water when the predicted tidal elevation was at least 0.5 m higher than the tide height at which the logger was deployed. Temperature logger readings (degrees Celsius) at 30-minute intervals.
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition_Source: Author defined
Attribute_Domain_Values:
Enumerated_Domain:
Enumerated_Domain_Value: air/transition
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition:
Air and transition when the tidal elevation and tide height do not match the parameters for air or transition temperature and the temperature reading does not align with water temperature.
Enumerated_Domain_Value_Definition_Source: Author defined
Attribute:
Attribute_Label: temperature
Attribute_Definition:
Temperature logger readings (degrees Celsius) at 30-minute intervals. Most values are raw uncorrected readings downloaded directly from the temperature loggers. In cases where the temperature was logged at intervals other than 30 minutes, the value is an estimate based on interpolation.
Attribute_Definition_Source: Author defined
Attribute_Domain_Values:
Unrepresentable_Domain:
Temperature logger readings (degrees Celsius) at 30-minute intervals.

KBAYKATMKEFJWPWS_2006-2023_intertidalTemperature_Contributors.csv

Attribute_Definition:

Attribute_Definition:
The program within the agency who the Gulf Watch Alaska contributor is associated with. The null values "." indicate that the program of the collaborator is unknown.
